algorithms.paths

Class DP_Part

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.paths.DP_Anyk_Iterator
      • algorithms.paths.DP_Part
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DP_All, DP_Eager, DP_Lazy, DP_Quick, DP_Take2

    public abstract class DP_Part
extends DP_Anyk_Iterator
    Implementation of Anyk-Part for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on the Lawler procedure. The different variants are implemented as subclasses, each one implementing the abstract methods differently.
    Brief description of the algorithm: A global PQ holds candidate solutions that are incomplete (prefixes) but their future cost can be computed in constant time after the DP bottom-up phase. In each iteration a prefix is popped, expanded and returned as the top-k'th solution. To get the top-(k+1)'th solution, we generate new candidates from the last returned solution by taking its successors at each stage. The successors are computed according to a partial order on the decisions available at each state. Each variant has a different way of computing a partial order among the available decisions. This partial order is the one that specifies the successors. The variants are concrete subclasses of this abstract class and share the core method get_next().
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis
    See Also:
    Lawler procedure

    • Field Detail

      • global_pq

        protected PriorityQueue<DP_Prefix_Solution> global_pq
        Maintains all the prefix solutions that are candidates for the next best solution.

      • latest_solution

        protected DP_Prefix_Solution latest_solution
        Stores the solution returned in the previous call of get_next(). This is required because candidates generated from the top-k'th solution are found and inserted into the PQ in the (k+1)'th call.

      • latest_sidetrack_stage

        protected int latest_sidetrack_stage
        The stage in which latest_solution made a sidetrack (by going to a successor). It is the same as the length of the prefix that we popped in the previous call of get_next(), that was then expanded to latest_solution. By convention, latest_sidetrack_stage of the top-1 solution is 1.

        public DP_Part(DP_Problem_Instance inst,
               Configuration conf)
        Parameters:
        inst - The DP problem to run any-k on.
        conf - A configuration of execution parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • get_next

        public DP_Solution get_next()
        Description copied from class: DP_Anyk_Iterator
        Computes the next DP solution of DP_Anyk_Iterator.instance in ranked order (ascending cost). Ties are broken arbitrarily.
        Specified by:
        get_next in class DP_Anyk_Iterator
        Returns:
        DP_Solution The next best DP solution or null if there are no other solutions.

      • expand

        protected DP_Prefix_Solution expand(DP_Prefix_Solution pref)
        Expands the prefix solution into a full solution by following an optimal sequence of decisions. The full solution reaches a terminal node.
        Parameters:
        pref - A prefix solution to be expanded optimally.
        Returns:
        DP_Prefix_Solution A new object that is a full solution.

      • add_candidates

        private void add_candidates(Collection<DP_Prefix_Solution> cands)

      • initialize_partial_order

        public abstract void initialize_partial_order(DP_DecisionSet decisions)
        Initialization of the data structures needed at each DP_DesicionSet in order to compute a partial order among decisions.
        Parameters:
        decisions - The set of decisions whose data structures will be initialized.

      • get_successors

        public abstract List<DP_Decision> get_successors(DP_Decision dec)
        Find the successors of a given decision among the other decisions in the DP_DecisionSet. The way that successors are computed depends on the variant (subclass).
        Parameters:
        dec - The decision whose successors will be computed.
        Returns:
        DP_Decision The successor decisions according to the (partial) order.

      • initialize_data_structures

        public void initialize_data_structures()
        Initializes the data structures needed for all nodes. Visits all the nodes in a DFS traversal.
